entry.content:
Moore's Law and Block Chain Exercises

Due Date:

Sunday, September 24, 11:59 pm

Objective:

To understand the basics of Supercomputing, Grid Computing, Cluster Computing, Quantum Computing, and Blockchain, and the implications they bring to businesses and consumers

Requirements

  • Answer Questions 1 & 2
  • Cite any sources that you use (best to use APA style)
  • Font: Georgia
  • Font size: range from 10 pt to 12 pt
  • Spacing: Single Space
  • Word Count: minimum 500 words
  • Submission: Please send word document to the email address: athluong@gmail.com; with subject "Week 3 Assignment"

Question 1:

Choose one among the following to answer:

  • a Bitcoin’s technology is in flux. Investigate how to get dollars into bitcoin, where you can pay for things using bitcoin, and how to get money out. Did you try this out? Why or why not? What do you think will need to happen with bitcoin for it to gain mainstream consumer acceptance?

  • b Investigate current uses of blockchain technology. Which seem successful? Have any failed? Report your results and share what you, as a manager, can take away from these experiments.

  • c To whom does bitcoin appeal? Why? Do some exploring online. Where is bitcoin accepted? Have any of these firms commented on results (positive or negative) of accepting bitcoin? Share your findings with your class and discuss likely resulting market trends.

Question 2:

Choose one among the following to answer:

  • a What are the characteristics of problems that are most easily solved using the types of parallel computing found in grids, clusters, and modern-day supercomputers? What are the characteristics of the sorts of problems not well suited for this type of computing?

  • b Search online to identify the five fastest supercomputers currently in operation. Who sponsors these machines? What are they used for? How many processors do they have?

  • c Show your familiarity with key terms: What are the differences between supercomputing, grid computing, and cluster computing? How are these phenomena empowered by Moore’s Law?

  • d Search online to assess the current state of quantum computing. What kinds of problems might be solved if the promise of quantum computing is achieved? How might individuals and organizations leverage quantum computing? What sorts of challenges could arise from the widespread availability of such powerful computing technology?

Hi everyone,

Just want to give you an overview of what you need to know and complete this week.

New Site

Syllabus & Schedule You can find the Syllabus and Tentative Schedule Outline by clicking on "Syllabus" and "Schedule" on the top of the site. The schedule is not fixed, and there might be some minor changes in the content we cover in some weeks. I will send out announcements in advance if such changes occur. Similarly, in the case that the Syllabus needs changes in some details as the semester progresses, I will inform you of them in the syllabus.

Assignments For each week, I will post the assignments' requirements here, you can click on "Assignments" at the top of the site, and find the assignments according to the weeks there.

Materials This page provides you with what you need to learn each week - lecture slides, readings (textbook &/or articles), and videos.

It is important and required that you always check the pages "Announcements", "Materials", and "Assignments" for each week.

Resources This page is meant to be a convenient hub of important links, some of which you are required to use for the readings and assignments of the class (blacboard, textbook, google drive), some of which are optional and serve as additional resources that can benefit your studying.

Week 3 Requirements

To access lecture slides, find out about the required readings, and video watching for week 3, go to Materials > Week 3 Materials

To view week 3 assignments, go to Assignments > Week 3 Assignments

NOTE: to submit your homework, email to this address: athluong@gmail.com with subject "Week 3 Assignment"

Group Formation

In the following weeks, there will be some weeks that I will assign homework exercises for groups. Additionally, there will be group projects (Excel & Access).

Thus, it is important that you form groups of 3 members as soon as possible (preferably by mid-week next week, so you guys can complete the written assignments in groups for next week). Since our class has 61 students, one group will have 4 members.

I have created a google spreadsheet and you can enter your names according to the groups that you have formed. The link to the google spreadsheet is posted in the page "Resources" ("Group List").

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,

Anh Luong

To take the quiz: Go to the Blackboard page of the class, click on Course Documents and then "Online Quiz 2".

Strategy & Technology Cases Exercise

Due date: Friday, September 15, 11:59 pm

Objective: To understand IT-enabled business strategies and their implications for businesses and customers.

What do you need to do?

  • Choose only two (2) questions from the following list, and answer them in a word document. Upload the document in Blackboard.
  • Cite any sources that you use (best to use APA style)
  • Font: Georgia, or Times New Roman
  • Font size: range from 10 pt to 12 pt
  • Spacing: single space
  • Length: for the two questions combined should range from 1 to 2 pages. (it's okay to go over 2 pages, but not okay to be less than 1 full page).

List of questions: (remember, choose only 2 out of these)

  • a Who are the rivals to the Netflix streaming effort? Do any of these firms have advantages that Netflix lacks? What are these advantages?

  • b How does Netflix build its data asset? In what ways does it leverage this data asset? Why is the data asset stronger under Netflix's streaming than it was for Netflix's DVD-by-mail business?

  • c How has Netflix leveveraged crowdsourcing and code contests?

  • d Have you seen a Amazon physical bookstore or kiosk? If so, what was your experience like? (You can visit one near Herald Square area). If not, browse online to find videos or write-ups about these. Based on your experience and/or your online findings, discuss what you think about Amazon's reasons for opening these physical stores/kiosks. Do they make sense? Why, why not, or under what conditions?

  • e Why are grocery stores attractive for Amazon? In what ways is Amazon entering the grocery business and how do these models differ? Are any aspects of Amazon's various grocery models appealing to you? Have you ever shopped for groceries online? If yes, share your experience. If not, detail the reasons why.

  • f Do you use personal cloud services? Do you use Amazon products, or products provided by rivals? Why have you made these choices regarding cloud platforms? Are network effects at work in cloud platforms? How so? What kinds of complementary products might make AWS seem more attractive than a new cloud computing effort?
